pullRequest.body:
Salem and Spencer were neither the first to write a paper on them, nor gave the best bounds, hence the current choice of name is a bit odd (and so is the Wikipedia page).

This PR renames `MulSalemSpencer` to `ThreeGPFree` and `AddSalemSpencer` to `ThreeAPFree`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: :v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I will go with "No" because I believe I am aware of all additive combinatorics projects downstream of mathlib.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

This is an appropriate change of terminology to agree with the literature.

bors d+

One again, I'll let you decide if a deprecation for the definition is worthwhile.
Modulo docstrings errors the patch here looks fine; can you get another combinatorist to sign off on the rename?
This is an appropriate change of terminology to agree with the literature.

bors d+

One again, I'll let you decide if a deprecation for the definition is worthwhile.
Is this true of the multiplicative version?

```suggestion
@[to_additive "A set is **3AP-free** if it does not contain any non-trivial arithmetic progression of
```

Does `GPFree` or `gpfree` occur as a atomic part of any name that should not be translated to `APFree`/`apfree`? If there are no such cases, you can you just add `| "gpfree" => ["apfree"]` to `nameDict`. That is the preferred way to translate "easy" cases.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Rename Salem-Spencer sets to 3AP-free sets
